notes: Hot+long with strong heat retention collapses fresh grape toward winey/jammy.
Reduction concentrates berry into jammy sweetness.
Long contact deepens sugar profile; fresh top fades.
Stonefruit concentrates into dried/darker read.
Extended contact nudges grape toward dried fruit.
Controlled reduction turns sharp peel into candied marmalade.
Peel-forward citrus shifts to marmalade with moderate reduction.
Delicate florals collapse under heat + turbulence.
OB loses lift with long, hot extraction.
Overextraction pushes perfumed to green-bitter.
Retained heat emphasizes toasted lactone tones.
Further reduction deepens caramel to molasses.
Slight softening moves sharp malic toward rounder pome.
Moderate length shifts grapefruit peel toward sweeter bitter orange.
Long warm extraction collapses fresh grape to light dried-fruit.
Dark skins skew winey under heat + length.
Long contact smooths tart spike toward jam.
Stonefruit concentrates into dried/apricot-like tone.
Moderate reduction softens citric edge, reading candied.
Gentle, long extraction lifts overripe/ester facets.
Gentle, slightly longer extraction rounds green guava into pink/ripe perception.
Longer contact blends distinct PF into composite tropical tones.
Moderate reduction emphasizes rind over volatile zest brightness.
Length tempers razor acidity; reads candied-lime.
Body + moderate reduction shift sharp lemon to custardy curd.
Anthocyanin-rich citrus still trends to marmalade under reduction.
Moderate length and warmth give candied-tangerine read.
Cool, gentle preserves linalool; reads tea-like.
Handled delicately, jasmine expresses as white tea rather than perfumey.
Short, cool extraction yields honeyed-citrus aura.
Kept cool and short, lavender retains perfumed lift.
Moderate reduction sweetens rose into jammy/confectionary register.
Front-loaded extraction expresses hibiscus as tart cranberry-like.
Longer, warmer extraction sweetens almond toward marzipan.
Nut + caramel pathway reads praline with added reduction.
Body/softness push vanilla into custard-like perception.
Deeper reduction thickens caramel into toffee.
Overshoot on heat/length tips toward bitter burnt sugar.
Slightly longer, calm extraction sharpens cacao into nib-like.
Moderate heat/body rounds nibby dryness toward bittersweet chocolate.
Gentle, slightly longer extraction rounds green guava into pink/ripe perception.

Moderate reduction caramelizes plain sugar perception.
Softer extraction rounds caramel into butterscotch.
Longer heat shifts sweet milk chocolate toward darker cacao.
Deep reduction adds treacle/molasses to dark cacao.
Extended calm extraction brings nutty-roast from nibs.
Nut + chocolate synergies read as gianduja.
Sweetened almond perception leans amaretto under reduction.
Moderate smoothing blends clove into allspice-like warmth.
Longer contact emphasizes woody bark over sweet dust.
Rounded extraction blends nutmeg into broader brown spice.
Moderate reduction sweetens and softens ginger bite.
Gentle extraction emphasizes sweet/floral facets.
Slightly longer extraction turns tannic tea toward malty-sweet.
Warm, calm length steers green tea impressions toward toasted rice.
Overextraction pushes fresh herbal into bitter/amaro-like.
Overextraction drives rosemary toward bitter resinous pine tone.
Longer, calm extraction steers thyme toward savory spice register.
Time + heat dry out fresh sage tone into dried herbal.
Light contact cools basil tone into mint-adjacent freshness.
Short, focused extraction emphasizes menthol core of mint.
Cool, short brewing gives eucalyptus a softer menthol freshness.
Moderate extraction balances dill’s sharper top notes.
Extraction length deepens anise into root-sweet licorice.
Long extraction softens licorice into molasses-like root sweetness.
Heat + reduction steer tamarind into tart dried fruit space.
Long contact concentrates fig into darker prune tone.

Extended brew shifts dried grape into prune-like richness.
Long, hot extractions draw molasses-like syrup from prune base.
Moderate body/length smooths blackcurrant into cassis.
From liqueur‑like to wine‑like as sweetness reduces and acids rise.
Reduction softens elderberry to mellow mulberry.
Deepened berry becomes more stonefruit-jam-like.
Further reduction from jammy leads to syrupy molasses-berry impression.
Jammy berry shifts toward plum preserve under deep reduction.
Grape jelly evolves into a deeper Concord-style jam under longer extraction.
Long, aggressive extraction of skins builds tannin-like structure.

Hot reduction thickens fig sweetness toward molasses-like intensity.
Long high-retention brews deepen date into heavy treacle impression.

Softening transforms clean pear into poached texture and tone.
Extended brewing caramelizes malic apple into soft jam-like profile.

Mango and PF volatiles blur into blended tropical expression under warm extraction.
Sustained brewing shifts pineapple from bright to dense jam.
Reduction thickens tropical punch into cordial-like sweetness.
Guava deepens into jammy form with heat and time.
Warm, medium brew blends jackfruit toward ripe banana-like profile.
Calm medium brew shifts papaya toward softer mango-like ripeness.
Longer brewing sweetens lychee into candy-like expression.
Longan darkens toward syrupy, date-like depth under long extraction.
Gentle extraction softens generic melon into honeydew notes.
